data.title: Popup API for extension development?
data.body:
Excuse me in advance for probably putting this issue in the wrong place... 

I was wondering if VSCode has a Popup API of some sorts for extension development.

If you're not entirely sure what I mean, here's an example in Sublime: ![](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/2c9fceeb7237735751fa2e7a37c6af7e107de24b/687474703a2f2f696d6775722e636f6d2f664d374f5468672e706e67)

And in atom they give you the ability to use html I believe so an example of a popup (or "Marker Decoration") in Atom looks like this: ![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/tylerl0706/Doge-Atom-Package/master/assets/screen_shot.png)

Does VSCode have something similar to this that extension developers can use? If not, where can I request something like it?

Again, sorry if this is in the wrong location! Feel free to move this elsewhere!

Cheers!

data.title: Remove comma from not allowed characters in capture group
data.body:
Fix the comma break in syntax highlight, e.g., fields: 

``` yaml
publisher_id.`split(., 1, 1)`
```

currently the highlight will break at first comma

data.title: How to configure HTML, can automatically complete the head?
Support additional directories in module search path
Breakpoints are hit or miss when debugging the spell check extension
data.body:
- VSCode Version: latest 1.4.0 insiders
- OS Version: MacOS, Windows

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  `git clone git@github.com:Microsoft/vscode-spell-check.git`
2. `cd vscode-spell-check`
3. `code-insiders .`
4. launch extension
5. set breakpoint https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-spell-check/blob/master/src/Features/spellProvider.ts#L151
6. open a `.md` file
   **-> breakpoint should be hit**
7. insert `Thhhis` to the `.md`file
   **-> breakpoint should be hit**

Observation:
Out of a dozen attempts of steps 3 - 7 I hit the breakpoints only a couple of times. This on Mac and in a Windows VM using node 4.4.7, 6.2, and 6.3.1. It seems completely random when the breakpoint is hit and when not.

@seanmcbreen reported similar observations.

data.title: Cannot hit breakpoint
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4
- OS Version: Windows and OS X

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  git clone https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-spell-check.git
2.  place a breakpoint in the code - e.g. line 56 or 243

It will not hit it when run.
Sean

data.title: Terminal cursor does not invert text color
data.body:
Bug present in July but it's low impact so pushing fix to August.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/17382218/92c275f6-5984-11e6-86d8-05b9c06f3826.png)

data.title: Unexpected completion item when returning null for provideCompletionItems
Completion provider is invoked on more than just triggerCharacters
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Register a completion handler with a trigger character of `.` like `context.subscriptions.push(vscode.languages.registerCompletionItemProvider(DART_MODE, new DartCompletionItemProvider(analyzer), "."));`
2. Breakpoint on when the `provideCompletionItems` method

It seems to be firing all the time on loads of characters. Eg. I had a type `//a` into a blank Dart file (never touching full stop) and it triggered. This might be related to #719 but I'm not sure (since there is a `triggerCharacter` arg here that it's not being restricted to).

data.title: Feature Request: Fold derived/generated files

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0-insiders (commit 81e91db)
- OS Version:Windows 7 x64

One feature of IntelliJ IDEA I immediately fell in love with is its ability to treat a .ts file like a "folder" inside the tree view which expands to the generated/transpiled .js and sourcemap files. I'd really love to have this in VS Code, for then my coworkers would not laugh at me anymore for not using IntelliJ IDEA. :) This folding greately helps keeping the source folder clean, in case people choose to generate output files inside of it.

data.title: add a scrollbor into the integrated terminal
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open an integrated terminal
2. Run an operation with the output that is longer than one screen
3. Try to scroll to beginning of it without a mouse wheel

Expected: there should be a visible scrollbar
Actual: none

data.title: Collapsed code blocks do not stay collapsed when moved to different tabs.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: W10 Build 14393.10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a few files in left/center/right tab groups.
2. Collapse a {} in the a code file in the left/center/right tab group.
3. Grab the tab for the file and move it to a different tab group.
4. The collapsed {} expands instead of staying collapsed.

data.title: Unable to run extension development host on Ubuntu
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a new Ubuntu VM using 16.04 LTS
2.  `sudo apt-get install nodejs nodejs-legacy npm`
3. Install Code from the website
4. Clone an extension (eg. https://github.com/DanTup/Dart-Code/)

Extension fails to activate and the console in the main Code instance reports:

```
bash: cannot set terminal process group (-1): Inappropriate ioctl for device
bash: no job control in this shell
```

![ubuntu](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1078012/17380026/dc288004-59bc-11e6-8190-1427055f2f12.png)

data.title: Feature request: move cursor up/down between paragraphs
data.body:
This would be the same as the `{` and `}` commands in vi(m):
- `}`: move to next blank line
- `{`: move to previous blank line

I find this a helpful way to move up/down in a file faster than line-by-line but slower than page-by-page.

data.title: [ts] Syntax highlighting breaks when type of function returning generic type placed on newline
VirtualBox: VSCode showing an empty window after installation on Ubuntu
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS
- VM: VirtualBox 5.0.24
- Host: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Download Visual Studio Code from here: https://code.visualstudio.com/download
2. Install Paket by double click on .deb file
3. Launch VSCode via Ubuntu start menu

Then a window opens. But it is completely black with some lighter (gray) squares as you can see here:

![code](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3968185/17376423/cad12bd2-59b5-11e6-9816-044c4e2f4297.PNG)
### Remark

I had a similar problem with google chrome. It could be fixed by disabling gpu on start up of chrome.

data.title: [folding] Add Selection + Folding bug
Add an option to show output panel only if there is

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10 build 14393

When building with tools unsupported by VS, such as `csc.exe`, I'd like to have the output panel to show only if there is.

Because `csc.exe` with the `/nologo` option makes no output if there is no error or warnings.

So if everything goes okay, this is what I see:
![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6440374/17376460/a2e55ecc-5983-11e6-9d83-86de5b960fb8.PNG)

I'd like to not see the output panel at all if everything is okay, and see it only if there is warning or errors, without having to create complex problem matchers.

So setting `showOutput` to `output`, for example, should produce that behavior.

data.title: Search dialog should keep a history of searches
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Windows 8.1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Go to the search dialog
2. Type something and search
3. Type something else and search
4. Try to type the first letters of the first thing you searched for

What is expected to happen?:

The text box should be a dropdown instead just like in VS2015's search box, or at least do some autocompletion according to your previous searches.

data.title: [less] imports inside selectors
Open Intergrated Terminal  Crash on None-English Folder
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.3.1
- OS Version:Windows 10Pro x64 14393 and Windows 10Ent x64 10240

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a folder with a None-English Name,for instance, "helloWorld"
2. Right click on this folder and open in vscode.
3. Press `Ctrl +`` and Terminal Crash with exit code 1.
   Same error in Atom which is also Electron-based.
   The Error Code in vscode is useless,while in Atom,the error code shows as following:

`C:\Users\mzvast\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.9.1\resources\app.asar\src\task.js:52 Unable to start terminal process. Win32 error code: 267 Error: Unable to start terminal process. Win32 error code: 267
at Error (native)
at Server. (C:\Users\mzvast.atom\packages\platformio-ide-terminal\node_modules\pty.js\lib\pty_win.js:67:9)
at emitOne (events.js:90:13)
at Server.emit (events.js:182:7)
at Pipe.onconnection (net.js:1439:8)
(anonymous function) @C:\Users\mzvast\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.9.1\resources\app.asar\src\task.js:52
(anonymous function) @C:\Users\mzvast\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.9.1\resources\app.asar\src\task.js:126
module.exports.Emitter.simpleDispatch @ C:\Users\mzvast\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.9.1\resources\app.asar\node_modules\event-kit\lib\emitter.:25
module.exports.Emitter.emit @ C:\Users\mzvast\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.9.1\resources\app.asar\node_modules\event-kit\lib\emitter.:125
(anonymous function) @ C:\Users\mzvast\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.9.1\resources\app.asar\src\task.js:78emitTwo @ events.js:100
emit @ events.js:185
handleMessage @ internal/child_process.js:718
channel.onread @ internal/child_process.js:444`

The win32 error code 267 seem to be,according to [microsoft:](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms681382%28v=vs.85%29.aspx)

```
ERROR_DIRECTORY
267 (0x10B)
The directory name is invalid.
```

data.title: Add line numbers to search results

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: 10.11.5

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Do a search
2. Results are shown

Would be nice to see the line numbers. For example if you search for Bob you get the line where Bob exists shown but it would be nice if the line number was shown as a prefix.

data.title: Possible problem with multiple  `tsconfig.json` files in subdirectories
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10

Please see the demonstration project on git: https://github.com/a8775/vscode-tsconfig
## Setup

Tested with the following versions:
- nodejs 6.2.0
- typescript 1.8.9
- typings 1.3.2

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Clone the project
2. In project directory execute commands:
    - `npm install` - to download  dependencies
    - `typings install` - to download required typings files
## TypeScript

In working directory run the command: `tsc -p .`

Should compile correctly.
## vscode

Select the right file in a editor window and compile the project:
1. Select the the file: `./MySubProject/mySubProjectFile.ts` 
2. Compile the project: `Ctrl-Shift-B`

The project should be compiled without errors. 

Now press space in any _syntactically correct_ place. You get compilation errors.

data.body:
Hi,

is it possible to have vscode use high contrast, but with a custom theme ?

if yes, how ?

data.title: Markdown - Codeblock within lists lacks highlighting in editor

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
## Basic Information
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: OSX (if required I can try to reproduce on Windows)
## Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open markdown file
2. Create list doesn't matter whether it is 1 or more levels.
3. Add a code block inline

_**Two Examples Follow**_
## Example 1:

from this [gist](https://gist.githubusercontent.com/clintel/1155906/raw/6b2a78696ff6b0b7222691c52fd0f3c6b98e3172/gistfile1.md)

`````` typescript
1. This is a numbered list.
2. I'm going to include a fenced code block as part of this bullet:

    ```
    Code
    More Code
    ```

3. We can put fenced code blocks inside nested bullets, too.
   1. Like this:

        ```c
        printf("Hello, World!");
        ```

   2. The key is to indent your fenced block by **(4 * bullet_indent_level)** spaces.
   3. Also need to put a separating newline above and below the fenced block.
``````
## Example 2

Best Practices
- Start from the Project's Documentation, not their Source if possible
- Use _Namespaces_ for;
      - variable types
      - parameters
- Callbacks - (_functions as parameters_) - When writing the function signatures for these types, do not mark those parameters as optional. The right way to think of this is What parameters will be provided?, not What parameters will be consumed?.
- Extensible Declarations - using namespaces you can have a variable named the same in the current namespace, but with additional parameters...
  - [Declarations Merging](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/declaration-merging.html) for more details
    
    ``` typescript
    interface SomePoint { x: number; y: number; }
    declare var MyPoint: SomePoint;
    
    interface SomePoint { z: number; }
    MyPoint.z = 4; // OK
    ```
- xxx
## Output (attached):

![screen shot 2016-08-03 at 8 51 25 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5379325/17372176/874800d8-5957-11e6-99ec-7955f47c5f23.png)

_As you can see the output is colorized perfectly fine, it is the editor side that is lacking_

However, it is only present within lists, as soon as I remove the indentations, the colorization within the editor returns.... see:
## Output (attached):

![screen shot 2016-08-03 at 8 52 41 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5379325/17372207/abd0e064-5957-11e6-9f64-6778150b3a8a.png)
## Further information
- This does not seem to be the same issue as #9457 - as multiline blocks work when non-indented, and single blocks never work when indented.
- This issue occurs whether I am using tabs or spaces.

data.title: refine DocumentLinkProvider
data.body: This PR implements #9940

data.title: CMD+D in JSON
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0-insiders
- OS Version: OSX

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create `test.json` file with content

```
{
    "key": [
        "This is test"
    ]
}
```
1. Put your cursor inside `test` word
2. Press CMD+D
3. Problem: Entire string is selected - not a single word `test`

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1723815/17369694/47c83828-5967-11e6-9fb2-66eecde6d2a1.png)

It works fine in `.js` file:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1723815/17369718/5ffaa4ee-5967-11e6-9e2b-6d1a09bca0ad.png)

data.title: add custom link provider for vscode.d.ts

data.title: custom LinkProvider for `vscode.d.ts`
data.body: Make use of the new `DocumentLinkProvider` api and detect links in markdown to other symbols in `vscode.d.ts`

data.title: Extension API - How to determine debug state
data.body:
Dear vscode-team

I've got another question for you guys.
Is there any possibility to determine if VSCode is actually debugging?

My idea is to do something like this:

If a file changes, AND vscode is in debug mode (with `f5`), I want to run a certain command.

As I'm aware of, one can define a `when` on a key binding but is this possible from the extension API?

Cheers
Chris
